turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Blood oath.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: He says, "Swear.  When we're both 28, if we've never been married... we marry each other!"

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You think...

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Desperate.  To talk.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: He's not proposing marriage, there's no way I'm buying one word of th...

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Then why are you compulsively eating? If you're not hysterical?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: He can't do that to me!

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: We're about to find out.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: We'll never be the same.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: I have a suggestion...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I'll have to kill myself before I call him.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You have no appropriate sense of emergency.  My best friend is ruining his life.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: No, he's ruining yours.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Same difference.  If you love someone, it's your duty to save them from themselves.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: You have a real philosophy of life.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: It's called the Law of Love, asshole.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: He's adored me for nine goddamn years.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: I can see why.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: She knows him maybe five seconds, plus she has billions of dollars, plus she's perfect, so don't go feeling sorry for Miss Pre-Teen Illinois!

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Chill.  We don't want your face coming off with it.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Chill?  Since when do you say ch...

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: When I'm talking to children.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You flew all the way h...

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: I noticed.  I'm on the noon back. We have this thing with George's family in the Hamptons.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You're butting in.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: What I mean, when I say annoyingly perfect, is that there is nothing annoying about her perfection. It is vulnerable and endearing. And that is annoying as shit.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: You like her.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: If I didn't have to hate her, I'd adore her.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I was devastated.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Go figure you.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Because I realized.  When I see him say "I do," that knife will be in my heart.  And it will be there every...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: There are 18,250 nights in the next 50 years...

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: You've been working on this, huh?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... and having "done the right thing" will only really be comforting, oh, maybe, five, six times.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: This is my whole life's happiness. I have to be ruthless.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: And you believe that.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: He was in love with me every day for nine years.  I can make him happier than she can.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: It's not his happiness you're feeling guilty about...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I don't know the meaning of the word guilt!

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Impressive.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I am breaking her heart in the short run, but doing her a gigantic favor! She would be miserable tagging along after this insensitive doofus!

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: The man you love.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Beyond reason.  The feminist warrior will rise up in this kid, and she'll be standing over his sleeping form with a butcher knife, selecting from a short list of body parts!

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Someday she'll thank you.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Let's not get carried away.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Jesus.  You're supposed to take your make-up off before you apply the m...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I KNOW THAT!  I WAS DISTRACTED BY GRIEF!

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Zit cream?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I wish.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Neosporin?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Try less appropriate.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Ben Gay.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: That was Thursday.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Elmer's Glue?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: DON'T BE RIDICULOUS, WE'RE HAVING A SERIOUS CONVERSATION!

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: I give.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I can't even say it.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: How do you know you can touch that plug? Are you a licensed contractor?

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: What do you suggest?

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: I suppose it's too late to start over.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: It's too late to start over.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Two words.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Major.  Dish.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Manicure...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You're going to say it, aren't you?

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Tell him you love him.  With all your heart.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I'm taking my next book to Viking.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Tell him you've loved him for nine years, but you were afraid to realize it.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I'm moving this book to Viking.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Tell him you're afraid of love. Afraid of needing.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Needing.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: To belong to someone.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Tell him you know this is the worst, dumbest, cruelest moment to do this to him.  But there it is, and he has to choose.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: And what will he do?

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Digger and George are with family in the Hamptons until Monday morning.  Brevity is even more in order than usual.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Hey, handsome.  Brevity this...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I did what I came to do.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Good girl.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I'll think about it.  I'm okay.

turns.speaker: DIGGER
turns.text: Oh, you're more than okay.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: All I've heard, from the day I met Michael, is Julianne this, and Julianne that...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well, we're...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I think the best part of marrying this guy is finding you.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: My heart's in my throat, here. Right off, I have to ask this monstrous favor...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You need a few dollars.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I can be quick.  I can even be funny.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: But I can't be dry.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Can you watch the road?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: See.  Dry.  It's in the delivery.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: This is a very presumptuous and burdensome fav...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... you want a menage on your wedding night.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: You can't believe what it'd cost to bring in a temp.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Uh.  How about promoting a bridesmaid?  Someone you know for at least forty-five minutes.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: The bridesmaids are my only two female relatives under forty. Identical twin debutantes from Nashville, who are basically vengeful sluts.  With amazing bodies!

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Which was the disqualifying factor?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: The twin part.  I like to remain impartial in my contempt.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I thought bridesmaids had to wear the same dress.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Not you.  You won't be comfortable unless you're distinctive.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: What else did he tell you...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: ... you hate weddings, you never go.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: That's why Michael and I were the wrong fit.  Right from the start.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: He said that, too.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Don't you have to be somewh...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: ... just my bridal shower.  And Michael has to meet our dads and the groomsmen at Comiskey for a one-thirty game.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... luckiest guy in the Northern Fucking Hemisphere, is all I'm s...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: What? Because I'm a little understand...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... most sentimental schmucks I pity want a honeymoon after their wedding.  Just to top it off.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I'm excited Sports Illustrated gave him this kind of shot, he's only there a ye...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: So your honeymoon is exactly where?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: It depends.  If San Antonio sweeps Sacramento, we could start there. Or Phoenix.  Or depending on Indiana- Clevel...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... garden sports, all.  Little swing of maybe fifty degrees Fahrenheit, represents a packing challenge, but there's fine food and cocktails at a choice of Embassy Suit...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well.  You've been introduced to the symphonic range of...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: ... his snoring, yeah.  He says it's worse than ever.  That snaffle one...?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: How about...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: ... cigars in bed? I broke him on that.  But the bathroom's a swamp, he wears Reeboks to dinner, tells the same, admittedly funny, jokes three hundred times...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: He sucks soup through his front teeth.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: A trademark move, don't touch it.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: But he sure can kiss.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: It's been awhile.  I'll take your word.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: After two weeks of cataloguing all his faults, I made a command decision that changed my life.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: And loving him means loving all of this.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Do you get nervous in small confined spaces?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: So it's sweet of you to be protective...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Let me rephrase that...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: But nothing ever could, ever did, give me a moment's pause about this marriage...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Do you get hysterical in small confined spa...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: ... except one.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: You'll always be there.  In his mind.  The perfect creature he loved for all those y...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well, perfection can get wearing after whi...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I'm not joking.  I had to face up to all my competitive drives, and believe me, I've got 'em.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: And the answer was so simple.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I was gonna predict that.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: You win.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: You're enshrined in his heart and memory.  Unassailable. Which works out great.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I've missed a step.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: He has you on a pedestal.  And me in his arms.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Jesus, we're trapped!

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Ju...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: No, this happened to me once, almost, it was excruciating!

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: It's not just clubs.  This guy always knows the best everything. The best guitar store, the best beef ribs, the best Horowitz record, was he always like the...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... always.  The best dim sum, the best camping stuff...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Stop, we're embarrassing h...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... best valley in New Zealand, best... women's shoes...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: About Michael's job.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Oh, that.  I forgot I even said th...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I just think you're wrong, is all.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Probably am.  Forget I brought it up.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I mean, he loves his job.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Bad games, bad towns, bad pay, bad flights, bad hotels, real bad food. Homeless, rootless, lonely, maybe your copy gets into one issue out of four...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: But he always says...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... whatever is manly and independent.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: For the twins? What in the world is th...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Gold nose hair clippers.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Gold dog collars? They don't have dogs.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: So... one almost has to...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Exactly what?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: What you said.  Make it appear that he's doing you the favor.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: He'll see right through it.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Only.  If he wants to.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: In six months, he'll be happy, settled, successful...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: He won't get mad, huh?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Your call.  You can live a lie. In a fabulous selection of Red Roof Inns.  Or you can make one desperate stab at hap...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I just don't want to freak him out.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Uh, Kimmy...?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: We settled this.  And I reneged. That wasn't fair.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Look at all this beautiful food, so lovingly prepared...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: They'll eat it anyway, you ever been to a walk?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Who?  The jerk who's running your life?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: This must be... very, very, hard on him.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: What with the psychosis and all, yeah.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: When are you gonna come clean with your folks?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Don't you see...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: If you're waiting for "Do you take this man?", that's considered poor form.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: ... that this is all my fault?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Yeah, well, lots of couples are imcompat...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: I love him.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: In one minute.  You are going to feel so foolish.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: WHY DON'T YOU JUST DRIVE A STAKE THROUGH MY HEART?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Have you ever heard of. Irony?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I never want to go through this again.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: That's entirely understandable.

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: Have you sized up the groomsmen, Jules?  As M. of H., you get first fuck.  Don't pick the short, hairy, rich one.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... unless he has a hump.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well.  See.  That was a... reflex to see if it would...

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: ... look good on Kimberly.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Right.  And then it didn't want to come off.  Exactly.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I saw the show.

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: ... well, maybe it works on fingers, too.

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: Wallace egregious residence, Mandy speaking.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: It's Jules, you guys haven't had a call from, say, Kimberly, have you?

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: Oh, she's slipped out, the little monkey.  Prob'ly with Michael, doin' the nasty.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Ex-cuse me?

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: I had this crank call?  From some guy who thinks he saw her? I said, what would a bride be doin', on her wedding...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You are <u<so right.  What a nerve on that guy!  Bring my dress to church, huh?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: If he gives you grief, I'll have him skillfully beaten, where the wounds won't show.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I guess getting him whacked would be politically out of the question.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Under the circumstances.  Charmed to know you, Jules.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Nice meeting you, too, Walt.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: They both have some growing up to do.  But they're good people, they're starting with love. They've got time.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I think you're making a mistake, sir.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Is anybody watching?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I hope so.  This is all too mysterious to waste on just me.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Julianne, reading my son-in-law's mail, is not something...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Sir, this is important! Haven't you ever in your life cut one corner, to make something important turn out right?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: It's a fax from Sports Illustrated from Ben Isaacson, Michael's boss.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I know Ben.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I think he's been fired.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It doesn't say th...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: He's said some things over the past few weeks.  Look, this is why I came up with the idea of you offering him a job.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: And you think he's kept this to himself.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: He's too proud to beg for help. And if you wait till this comes out, your offer will be like charity. Completely humiliating.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Maybe.  I should call Ben.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Then it could all come out, sooner or later.  Nobody should be in on this.  Just you and me.  Or, more correctly, I.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I thought Michael was picking me up.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I told him, get the important stuff, Kim's ring.  I'll collect the inconsequentials.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I haven't caused... a problem, have I?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Nobody has.  So far.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Well, you're a little early...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I need to make some calls. Could I use... your office?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I've been calling for days!

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Yeh, well my old machine kept eating messages.  I tried constructively ignoring it in hopes of improvement, but finally...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well, that's great.  You haven't really had anybody since Dingbat Jennylee...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You don't understand.  I've never felt this way about anybody!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: And she's all wrong for me!

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well, somet...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I mean she's a junior at Chicago University, she's twenty years old! Like when I first met you.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well, sure.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: But they're so down to earth, such wonderful people...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You've met her parents.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Michael, it's Wednesday night, you can't possibly be getting married on Su...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Actually, it all starts tomorrow. It's one of those four-day weddings, with all the traditional events, and ten million people flying in from Madagascar such.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Well, the Sox are at home.  SI's letting me do a profile on the Big Hurt.  That's Frank...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... Thomas, yeh.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well, maybe we should talk ab...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I need you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Please come, please.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I can't wait for you to meet her!

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: What's the sec...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Mirrors.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Best everything, Joe.  But I'm going to dance with you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Dance?  You don't dance!  You learn to dance??

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I just admire your maturity, that's all.  I mean, there are people who would find that kind of perfection boring.  Day after day, year after year...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: ... see, that's what I thought at first.  How can you like someone that perfect? No potential for long-range livability.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Luckily.  The closer I watched, the more the fault came into focus.  Each imperfection its own adorable slice of vulnerability.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Such as.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: She's too genuine.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Hate that.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How can you trust someone you can never mistrust?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: What's next?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No matter how many times I leave the toilet seat up, she forgets and puts it down.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Endearingly absent-minded.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: My very point.  Here's another one...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Every day.  She makes the bed.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Quite the little eccentric.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: At first, I thought it was a gag, but she's always done it!

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Is there a coup de grace in here, somewh...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: She admires.  Tommy Lasorda.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Waiter! Check, please!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: She finds him "personable."

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Can that kind of defect be passed on genetically?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Gimme like, eight and nine off the top ten list...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: First girl I ever knew.  Who lets me give her a bath.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Where was that, Florence, huh?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Firenze.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: The Vespa? Me hanging on behind in the rain all night?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Till the gas ran out.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Should I whistle down a cab?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey, cabs are expensive.  I'm cheap, remember?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Pretty amazing girl, you've got. Make that kind of sacrifice.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What, leaving school...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... all of it.  She's leaving her family, her friends, everything she knows.  She's putting her career on hold, and she seems a pretty ambitious, driven, kind of pers...
